bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 21, 1901

div1.p: Reed teases Emilie Lawrence Reed. She complains about the appearance of their house in Washington.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 21, 1901
div1.p:
Who told you that
you were going to get five letters
a week? I said there would be
five mails per week - you sweet
rascal, don't you think that I am
too busy to be writing almost
Every day? I couldn't do it, last
week & I am afraid that my
sweet oomsey has been disap-
pointed, but I was giving all my
time to my work. Today, I was sur-
prised to receive two letters from
Sweet Miss Gouty (oh! I beg pardon!)
one of the 17th & the other of the 18th,
That was quick time and very sweet
in my darling wifie to write two
days in succession - am sorry that you
didn't see Mrs. Hoff- I have heard that
she is so very pleasant, but I hardly
think that she can be as nice as the
Doctor- Don't forget to call him “Major”.
Sweetheart, don't make so much “to
do” about the looks of the house!
There isn't anything the matter with
it- You are the only one who would
notice it- We can change next Fall
if you want to do so, but I think that
you will make a mistake- I should
think that Mrs. Thompson would
be quite an addition to the house-
Well, never mind, its hard to be satis-
fied in this world, and everyone has a
perfect right to growl- Excuse this very
short note, but I want to get it in
the mail- Kiss Sweet Miss Anna-Polis
for her father- Love & kisses & kisses
& love for my precious children-
